ratings.comment: Lectures are beyond boring. He is a very bad lecturer and it is very easy to get bored and distracted in his class. Just doesn't care about students.

Amazing lecturer, brilliant dude. Whenever he was asked a question, he would explain it in a way that made perfect sense. His exams were straightforward and easy if you understood the content. I can't recommend this professor enough. His teaching style made this class way easier and way more fun than it should have been.
Great lecturer especially for math 222, and clearly lays out tough concepts. Would 100% take again.
Goated calc 2 professor, made hard concepts seem easy. Lectures were very helpful if you read book before, really reenforces what you read and makes it clear. Definitely take.

Brian Lawrence was a good lecturer and a nice guy across the board. I saw him walking by my dorm once and he recognized me and said hi. This was one of the greatest moments of my life. Thank you Brian.
Amazing Professor! He knows the material well and makes a notoriously difficult class much simpler and easier to understand. I greatly appreciate his lectures and office hours.
Amazing
Brian had good lectures and was generally helpful
best math professer
Very smart man with engaging lectures, will be looking out for future classes that hew teaches
I was not a fan of the lectures.

Professor Lawrence knows the information in this class like the back of his hand. He conveys it easily in lecture and is by far the best professor I've had at this school. He's a great person and is great at talking about math, even if it was hard to understand. This class has a reputation of being extremely difficult, but it didn't seem as such.
worst calc teacher ive ever taken he doesnt post notes or slides and everything he does he makes up on the spot. if you want to understand calc dont take this class

Brian is everything you'd want in a professor. His lectures are engaging and organized and he does a good job explaining concepts. Nothing bad to say about this guy. Best math professor I've had at UW-Madison. Take him if you can.
He just has this way of making difficult concepts easier to understand.
Brian Lawrence is quite approachable. As long as you follow his steps, you can get a super good understanding of concepts.

A great professor overall. Wearing the same shoes for every lecture. He is really good at explaining what happens between the steps and concepts. He always has dozens of people during his office hours. HW was tougher than the exam and midterms. Make sure you do enough practice and you won't end up like me. He knows everything and what can go wrong.

I did not take this class with Brian Lawrence but I did sit in on his lectures because I had Chenxi Wu for my lecture. From what I saw of him in lectures he is an amazing teacher and helps you build concepts by taking them from the ground up. Amazing!

Brian has a unique and engaging teaching style that made me look forward to attending lectures. The piazza help section for this class was run very well, and it was easy to get a quick and indepth answer to anything you were struggling with. Exams do play a substantial role in the final grade, but Brian does a great job in helping you prepare.

Brian Lawrence is a great professor for math 222. He is very intelligent and friendly. His lectures are always interesting. For each example question, he will let us work on it first before showing us the solution. He asks the class about his teaching pace and lets the students ask questions before moving on to a new question.
Great Guy

Brian Lawrence is the best of the best when it comes to calc 222. He explains topics really clearly, but they don't always reflect what will be on exams, so you might need to put a lot of time into studying outside of the course as well.

B. Law kind of became known as a campus celebrity for his engaging lectures and informal way of teaching. You can tell that he really genuinely enjoys teaching mathematics and he knows his stuff. He was good about answering questions about problems during class, but not great at reviewing material before tests.
Great at explaining topics and was very engaging during lecture. Became a celebrity on campus and is now the GOAT of all math professors at UW. Will never have a better math prof than him tbh.

If you are looking for a professor to take, look no further than Brian Lawrence. At first, I was a little skeptical of his laidback nature and informal way of speaking, but I quickly realized how much more effective he is as a teacher in that regard. He teaches well, answers questions, and acknowledges all types of feedback. Amazing professor!!!

Definitely get Brian Lawrence for math 222 if you can. His lectures are awesome, and he clearly explains things, and you're able to ask questions in class. He knows how students learn and teaches accordingly. In comparison to Bobby Grizzard, just know that when Brian subbed for Grizzard's class, the students gave him a standing ovation after

My favorite lecturer so far at Madison. Makes the tough topics interesting to listen to, and includes lots of classroom participation. Also very kind and understanding of student needs. Overall a great professor, and would definitely recommend to people thinking about taking Math 222.
Hes a great teacher who makes the material easy to understand

I mean this when I say, if I were able to have Lawrence teach every one of my future math classes, I'd take it in a heartbeat. I took a gamble on him this semester because he was new and didn't have any ratings. But I'm so glad I did. He makes early morning calc lectures funny and is incredibly passionate on the subject. Take this guy if you can.
Prof. Lawrence is a super funny guy and he makes his materials accessible to all of this students. His personality definitely starts to come out in the later lectures and it makes class enjoyable.
Best math lecturer in my life.....
Very nice, willing to help
Amazing Professor, lectures were actually nice to attend since Brian had a good sense of humor and cares about his students when teaching.

I love Brian Lawrence. Amazing lectures and funny.

Calculus my beloved.
Absolute Academic Weapon
